intro: Hymenoxys richardsonii var. liguliflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hymenoxys, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a flat, disc-like structure. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the genus Hymenoxys.
